title: High-contrast light theme and app-wide readability fixes

requirements.summary: Apply a single high-contrast light theme across the app so all typography and interactive UI remains readable in all states.
acceptanceCriteria: All screens use a consistent palette (backgrounds, surfaces/cards, borders, primary/accent, text colors) without mixing incompatible schemes.
No UI relies on transparent/outlined text for readability (e.g., text must not disappear on gradients or light backgrounds).
All standard text meets WCAG AA contrast (minimum 4.5:1 for normal text; 3:1 for large text) against its background.

file_operations.description: Adjust the global light-mode theme CSS variables to a cohesive, high-contrast palette (background/surfaces/borders/text/primary/accent/muted/ring) designed for consistent readability across shadcn/Tailwind tokens.

Review and adjust any Tailwind theme extensions (colors/shadows/animations) as needed to align with the updated CSS token palette and ensure token-based colors (bg-background, text-foreground, bg-card, bg-popover, text-muted-foreground, ring) are the default choices across the app.
Ensure the app root/layout surfaces consistently use theme tokens (bg-background, text-foreground) and do not introduce page-level styling that could cause low-contrast text or transparent overlays.

requirements.summary: Update global theme tokens in index.css and remove/replace global utility styles that can force unreadable colors.
acceptanceCriteria: The default body text color and default surfaces (bg-background, text-foreground, card, popover) render with strong contrast.
All shadcn components (Buttons, Cards, Sheets, Popovers, Inputs, Select/Dropdown patterns) inherit readable colors from the updated tokens without requiring per-component hacks.
No global utility class forces white/transparent text in a way that reduces readability.

file_operations.description: Update :root and .dark CSS variables to match the new high-contrast theme (with a readable light-mode default), and remove or replace the .text-on-gradient utility so it cannot force white text (or other low-contrast text) on non-dark backgrounds.

requirements.summary: Refactor the Landing page to remove the blue-to-purple gradient hero and ensure all landing content uses solid, high-contrast text on readable surfaces.
acceptanceCriteria: The Landing page no longer uses the existing blue/purple gradient background and does not require white text for readability.
The main description paragraph (“Faith Unplugged is a 30-day devotional journey...”) is clearly readable on all screen sizes.
Buttons/links on the Landing page (including outline buttons) have readable text, visible borders, and clear hover/focus states.

file_operations.description: Remove the current gradient hero background layers and refactor the hero/sections to use theme token-based backgrounds and surfaces (bg-background/bg-card) with solid readable text (text-foreground/text-muted-foreground). Replace any .text-on-gradient usage and ensure buttons (default/outline) have visible borders and readable labels in all states.
If Landing previously depended on global gradient-text utilities, ensure any removed/replaced utilities do not break Landing styles and that Landing now relies on theme tokens for color.

requirements.summary: Fix readability in header navigation and the mobile sheet menu so labels/icons and focus rings remain clear in all states and overlay contexts.
acceptanceCriteria: Header text and icons are readable against the header background on all pages.
Mobile menu sheet content has readable text/icons and sufficient contrast for all menu items and the login/logout button.
Focus rings are clearly visible and do not blend into surrounding backgrounds.

file_operations.description: Audit and update header/nav button styling to rely on theme tokens (text-foreground, bg-background, bg-popover, border-border, ring) and ensure icon/text contrast for default/hover/active/disabled states. Update mobile SheetContent navigation button classes so overlay content remains readable and separators/borders are visible without hard-coded low-contrast colors.
Adjust global focus-visible styling if needed (outline/ring color/offset) so focus rings are consistently visible across header buttons, sheet menu items, and other overlay UI.

requirements.summary: Audit and fix remaining low-contrast text across all pages and common interactive patterns (including overlay content, placeholders, badges, tabs, and dropdown/popover content) to rely on theme tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: No page contains text that becomes invisible or difficult to read due to background color, transparency, or gradients.
Dropdown/select/popover-style content renders readable text and visible separators/borders (including in overlay layers).
All primary and secondary actions have clearly readable labels and sufficient contrast in all states.

file_operations.description: Audit and update any remaining hard-coded or semi-transparent styling that could reduce contrast; ensure buttons/cards/text use theme tokens (text-foreground, text-muted-foreground, bg-card, border-border) and maintain readable outline button borders and hover/focus states.

Replace decorative gradients and low-contrast background treatments (e.g., header gradients) with token-based solid surfaces (bg-card/bg-muted) where needed; ensure badges, separators, and all text (including italic/scripture blocks) stay readable and rely on theme tokens rather than hard-coded translucency.
Ensure empty states, cards, excerpts, and badges maintain high contrast (including muted text) and avoid overly transparent muted-foreground usage that could fail contrast on light surfaces.

Remove/replace any gradient-based button backgrounds and ensure Tabs/Triggers, badges (outline/secondary), dialog content, inputs/placeholders, and hover-revealed controls use token-based colors for readable text and visible borders in both base UI and overlay (Dialog) layers.

Audit prose blocks, card headers, badges, and status callouts to ensure readable text and borders; replace gradient headers or low-contrast accent backgrounds with token-based surfaces; ensure inputs/placeholders and destructive/success states remain readable without relying on transparency.

Ensure dashboard cards, milestone callouts, and the encouragement section avoid gradient-dependent readability; convert gradient sections to solid token-based surfaces and ensure all muted text remains readable. Remove or adjust the user identity snippet styling if needed to prevent tiny low-contrast text issues.

Audit cards, headings, and link styling to ensure consistent token-based colors for high contrast (including links on cards) and replace any decorative gradients with solid token-based surfaces if contrast risks remain.

Ensure labels, descriptions, inputs (including time input), helper text, and alert-like blocks use token-based colors with sufficient contrast; adjust any muted panels/borders that could cause placeholder/helper text to be hard to read.
Ensure footer background/surface and link colors are token-based and maintain readable contrast against the footer surface (including hover/underline states).
